business.headline: Piyush Goyal to visit US for trade talks on September 22 amid tariff, H-1B tensionsThe minister will visit New York and will be accompanied by special secretary in the ministry Rajesh Agrawal and other officials.

H-1B visa holders cancel trips to India for weddings, Diwali amid new fee hikeWhile many cancelled plans to travel at the last minute while waiting to board flights to India, several others already in India are scrambling to return amid lack of clarity after Trump on Friday signed a proclamation to raise the H-1B visa fees.

Amul cuts prices of 700 products, ghee cheaper by Rs 40 per litre from Sept 22Amul, marketed by the Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF), on Saturday announced a price reduction for over 700 products, including ghee, butter, ice cream, cheese, and frozen snacks. The move comes after a GST rate cut, with the company passing the benefits to consumers.

H-1B visa fee hike will disrupt Indian tech ops, 1-day deadline concerning: NasscomNasscom cautioned that Indian nationals employed on H-1B visas will be directly impacted, while technology companies will face disruption in ongoing client projects requiring onshore deployment.

ITR refund delayed? Here's why the process may take longer this yearTax refunds this year are taking longer than usual, leaving many taxpayers waiting and prompting questions about delays, processing times, and what to expect in the weeks ahead.

Why India's insurance market has become a breeding ground for mis-sellingFrom loans tied to unwanted policies to agents chasing fat commissions, insurance policies that were meant to shield families have instead become a trap for many.

Cryptocurrency a bigger challenge to dollar than BRICS currency, says WEF PresidentSpeaking in an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Brende said de-dollarisation is unlikely in the near term. He added that cryptocurrency is a bigger challenge to the dollar than a potential BRICS currency.

India powers 18% of global growth, WEF chief sees tariff row with US easing soonIn an exclusive interaction with India Today TV, WEF President Borge Brende described India's rapid expansion as a source of "exported prosperity" to the world. "Just imagine what it means for global prosperity. So, you are exporting prosperity by growing so fast," he said.

A widow's wait, a worker's fight: The human struggle behind PF claimsIn Part 2 of our series on the PF claim crisis, we look at why, for so many Indians, withdrawing their own savings has turned into a struggle, forcing them to fight for money that is rightfully theirs.

Will October bring a market breakout? Earnings, GST price cuts fuel hopeAdani stocks led the rally on Thursday following Sebi's dismissal of Hindenburg Research allegations. Experts say this could mark the start of renewed market optimism.
Sensex, Nifty end lower amid profit booking; Adani Group shares gainThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 387.73 points to close at 82,626.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 96.55 points to settle at 25,327.05.

Explained: Why Intel shares jumped 22% after Nvidia's $5 billion investmentThe Nvidia-Intel deal not only fuels Intel's stock surge but strengthens its next-gen manufacturing and product integration, creating potential market shifts that could challenge competitors like AMD over the coming years.

entertainment.headline: Mammootty to Khushboo, celebs congratulate Mohanlal for Dadasaheb Phalke AwardActors Mammootty and Khushboo Sundar, amongst others, extended their best wishes to Mohanlal. On Saturday, it was announced that the actor will be honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award at the 71st National Film Awards.

Assam declares three-day mourning over singer Zubeen Garg's deathAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has directed a state mourning over late singer Zubeen Garg's death. All official entertainment and celebrations have been put on hold during the mourning.

Mohanlal to receive Dadasaheb Phalke Award for contribution to Indian cinemaMalayalam superstar Mohanlal is set to receive the Dadasaheb Phalke Award for contribution to Indian Cinema. The award will be presented to him at the 71st National Film Awards on September 23.

Exclusive: Jennifer Aniston wants to come for silent retreat and meditation to IndiaHollywood star Jennifer Aniston shared in an exclusive interview that she wants her next visit to India to be centred on spirituality. She hopes to take part in a silent retreat and experience meditation in India.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan schools Gaurav, Mridul over inactivity, playing safeActor Salman Khan returned to Bigg Boss 19 after missing last week's episode. He schooled contestant Mridul Tiwari for playing too safe inside the reality series.

Are Saiyaara's Aneet and Ahaan dating in real life? Here's what we knowActors Aneet Padda and Ahaan Panday, the lead pair from 'Saiyaara', are reportedly dating in real life. However, they have been advised to keep their relationship private for now.

The Diplomat Season 3 trailer: Keri Russell lands in unexpected political stormThe first trailer for 'The Diplomat Season 3', featuring actors Keri Russell and Bradley Whitford was recently released. The new season promises intense political drama following the death of the president and rising tensions within the British government.

Homebound picked for Oscars: Kareena, Arjun, Ananya and others extend wishesActors Kareena Kapoor, Arjun Kapoor, Ananya Panday, among other celebrities have congratulated the team behind 'Homebound.' The film has been selected as India's official entry for the 2026 Oscars.

Kapil Sharma's Netflix show faces Rs 25 crore lawsuit over Baburao characterProducer Firoz Nadiadwala has issued a legal notice against Netflix for unauthorised use of the Baburao character. The lawsuit highlights serious copyright and trademark violations, demanding removal and apology.

Exclusive: Jennifer Aniston, Reese Witherspoon discuss AI, say it's frighteningActors Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoon discussed AI's impact, labelling it as 'frightening', in an exclusive interview with India Today. Their fourth season of their series 'The Morning Show', addresses AI, deepfakes, and media challenges.

Manoj Bajpayee marks 6 years of The Family Man, shares Season 3 updateAs 'The Family Man' marked six years of release, actor Manoj Bajpayee shared an update on its third season. Directors Raj and DK also expressed gratitude to fans for the success of the series.

Akshay Kumar credits career to stuntmen on The Great Indian Kapil ShowActor Akshay Kumar credited his career's success to stuntmen on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show season 3' finale. He also shared a light-hearted banter with the show's host Kapil Sharma and the rest of the cast as he engaged in playful activities.

Jolly LLB 3 box office day 1: Akshay, Arshad's comedy surpasses Sky Force, Kesari 2Actor Akshay Kumar's 'Jolly LLB 3' opened to a Rs 12.5 crore net collection on day one. The courtroom comedy-drama also features actor Arshad Warsi in a pivotal character.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 27: Abhishek becomes new captain, Baseer-Gaurav clashAbhishek Bajaj is the new captain of 'Bigg Boss 19' house. The actor won the position after a competitive task. In episode 27 of the reality show, a heated argument also erupted between Gaurav Khanna and Baseer Ali.

Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa call Homebound's India's Oscar entry moment surrealActors Ishaan Khatter and Vishal Jethwa reacted to 'Homebound' getting selected as India's entry for the 98th Academy Awards. The Neeraj Pandey directorial also features actor Janhvi Kapoor in a crucial role.

KBC 17: Contestant Pallavi Niphadkar opens up about undergoing seven miscarriagesPre-primary teacher Pallavi Niphadkar opened up about experiencing seven miscarriages on the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati'. She told host Amitabh Bachchan about her health struggles and shared how adoption brought positivity into her life.

Homebound review: Neeraj Ghaywan's film on caste, faith holds a mirror to societyRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025Homebound review: Director Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' is not just to be watched; it's a heavy, unforgettable cinematic experience that holds up a mirror to a reality you can no longer pretend you didn't know, leaving you with a profound sense of responsibility.

Bollywood's franchise fever: Why filmmakers keep chasing part twos and universesAre you a fan of franchises? Bollywood is hooked on them, banking on them and building universes for box-office wins. Experts from the industry shared why nothing but fresh storytelling can keep the magic alive.

Deepika shares emotional post on 6th collaboration with SRK after exit from Kalki 2Actor Deepika Padukone confirmed her role in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' after leaving the 'Kalki 2989 AD sequel'. This move highlights ongoing industry shifts and creative disagreements in major film projects.

general news.headline: New US H-1B visa fee of $100K will apply only to new applications: US officialThe US clarified its new $100,000 H-1B fee applies only to fresh applicants, not current holders, easing panic among Indian tech workers after Trump's visa overhaul sparked fears of mass disruption.

To have humanitarian consequences: India on US' new H-1B visa fee impactNew Delhi urged Washington to address the humanitarian impact of the new USD 100,000 annual H-1B visa fee, stressing that skilled talent exchange is vital for growth and innovation in both countries.

India-US flight fares soar after Trump's H-1B visa move, airports see chaosNew H1B visa rules: H-1B holders in India saw a massive jump in the cost of a direct flight to the US as airlines looked to cash in on the chaos unleashed by US President Donald Trump.

Will Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen Bomb explode on the Congress?Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's all-out campaign on 'vote chori' and the SIR exercise has raised eyebrows within his own party, with fears it could alienate allies and voters in Bihar. With Gandhi building up the "hydrogen bomb" hype, the Congress faces a dangerous gamble.

Bright fireball seen over Delhi-NCR may not have been a meteorThe phenomenon, reported around 1:20 am on September 20, is suspected to be debris from China's Long March 3B rocket stage (CZ-3B R/B, ID 61188) that had been predicted to re-enter Earth's atmosphere.

India's biggest enemy is dependence: PM Modi amid US tariff, H-1B visa movesPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said India's biggest adversary was its dependence on other nations, while urging for self-reliance in sectors from semiconductors to shipbuilding. His remarks came after the US imposed steep tariffs on Indian imports and raised H-1B visa fees drastically.

Andy Pycroft set to be match referee for IND vs PAK Super 4 clash: SourceAsia Cup 2025: Andy Pycroft will officiate the India-Pakistan Super 4 match despite earlier controversy during the group stage clash in Dubai.

India has a weak PM: Congress trains gun on Modi after Trump's H-1B clampdownCongress, led by Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge, criticised PM Modi as a "weak" leader whose foreign policy has failed to protect Indian interests after the US imposed a new $100,000 annual fee on H-1B visas.

Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee is a low blow to IndiaNew H-1B Visa Rules: Just three days ago, Donald Trump wished PM Modi on his birthday, signalling a thaw in ties. Two days later, he revoked the sanctions' waiver for Chabahar Port and imposed a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas. Is Trump playing the classic 'good cop, bad cop' negotiation strategy with India?

Why Trump's H-1B crackdown could spark India's talent renaissanceSeveral Indians have lashed out at US President Donald Trump's executive order to impose a USD 100,000 (over Rs 88 lakh) annual fee on H-1B visas, saying the move will "kill" the American economy and boost the Indian economy.

Super 4 begins with thriller as Bangladesh snap Sri Lanka's unbeaten streakBangladesh clicked with both bat and ball to snap Sri Lanka's unbeaten streak in the Asia Cup 2025. The win was not without drama as the Litton Das side nearly bottled the chase with 1-run remaining.

Zelenskyy wants US to impose strong sanctions on RussiaUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy expects the United States to impose strong sanctions on Russia, he said on Saturday, a day after the European Union presented its 19th sanctions package on Moscow.

No vacancy for PM post: Rajnath Singh backs Modi as BJP candidate for 2029, 2034Defence Minister Rajnath Singh recalled Modi's rise as BJP's campaign convenor and PM candidate in 2013, and said there was "no vacancy" for the Prime Minister's post in many elections to come.

Passengers in 1st AC coach caught stealing bedsheets, towels. Video goes viralA family travelling in the 1st AC coach of Purushottam Express was caught stealing railway-issued bedsheets and towels. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media.

How Modi transformed from Chief Minister to Prime Minister: Amit Shah explainsNarendra Modi's shift from Gujarat Chief Minister to India's PM maintained his unwavering focus on national priorities, with only the scale and scope of challenges expanding, Amit Shah said in an exclusive interview with India Today.

Preschool fees soar to lakhs: Are parents paying for toddler education or gloss?Over the past couple of years, viral posts have exposed the steep rise in preschool fees, with parents in cities like Bengaluru, Delhi and Jaipur paying lakhs per year. Once affordable neighbourhood playschools, today's preschools are big business, offering things like robotics kits and glossy facilities, leaving many middle-class families torn between aspiration and financial strain.

Mandhana's record century in vain as Australia seal series in Delhi run festIndia women lost the third ODI against Australia women by 43 runs as they failed to chase down the humongous target of 413. Smriti Mandhana smashed a record-breaking fastest century by an Indian woman off just 50 balls.

sports.headline: India predicted XI for Super 4 clash vs Pakistan: Will Arshdeep retain his place?India and Pakistan are set to lock horns in the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup 2025 in Dubai. The Men in Blue will face another dilemma while seletin the perfect playing combination for the crucial fixture.

Saif Hasan reveals Bangladesh's good plan after thrilling win over Sri LankaBangladesh's 'Player of the Match' Saif Hassan said his side had entered the Asia Cup Super 4 clash on Saturday with a "good plan" against the Sri Lankan bowlers, and it paid off brilliantly in a tense encounter.

Relief for Ruben Amorim as Manchester United secure priceless win vs ChelseaManchester United eased the pressure on head coach Ruben Amorim by holding on for a 2-1 victory over Chelsea in a frantic encounter at Old Trafford that saw both sides reduced to ten men.

Pakistan have not played good cricket in 2 years: Deep DasguptaIndia play Pakistan in their first Super 4 fixture on Sunday, September 21. Former India cricketer Deep Dasgupta feels that the match is not going to be much of a competition.

Smriti Mandhana on record ODI hundred vs Australia: Not my best as India lostIndia vice-captain Smriti Mandhana on Saturday said her record ODI hundred against Australia was "not my best," as India lost the series-deciding match by 43 runs, handing the hosts a 1-2 series defeat.

PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi meets Pakistan team in Dubai ahead of India clashAmid the ongoing handshake row and continuing tension with ICC match referee Andy Pycroft, PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi made a surprise visit to Pakistan's training session ahead of their highly anticipated Super Fours clash against arch-rivals India at the Asia Cup in Dubai on Sunday.

Out of form Shubman Gill attends optional net session before Pakistan matchIndia vice-captain Shubman Gill hit the nets ahead of India's Asia Cup clash against Pakistan. Gill, who batted poorly in his last two matches, will be desperate to return back in form.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
